Dont put stuff in /tmp, it needs to be cleared on reboot. Changing this functionality will have unexpected results.

So? /tmp is designed to be cleared on reboot.

This isnt like windows, user temporary things usually get stuck in your user's home folder somewhere.  /tmp is for stuff you shouldnt touch, like application locks. You want those to dissapear when you reboot.
I suggest you find a new place to stick stuff instead of /tmp
This is like putting files in the trashcan by your desk and wondering why every morning your files are gone.
